main.name: Lori Liu
main.description: Interested in Cognition, Artificial Intelligence, and Statistics
main.bio: I am a motivated student researcher pursuing higher education in the field of mind, artificial intelligence, and affective computing. I believe the power of cognitive science in every aspect of our lives and would employ my skills and passion in my current and future research projects which hopefully contribute to the welfare of all human beings.
main.contactmessage: Eager to Know You! And You?

education.description: Double major in Cognitive Science and Statistics, minor in Computer Science. Eager to combine visions of diverse disciplines to create systems and applications to understand, interpret, and facilitate human behaviors and cognitive activities.

work.company: Computer Science & Engineering Dept, UC San Diego
work.title: Tutor
Undergrad Researcher
work.description: Focus on collecting data from a self-assembled light sensor and use such a database for training a model to predict light exposure level through machine learning algorithms (multi-layer neural network).

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Built coupled nonlinear oscillators for a leg of Drosophila melanogaster biomechanical model using Python. Optimize 37 parameters using Particle Swarm Optimization.

work.company: Cognitive Science Dept, UC San Diego
work.title: Instructional Assistant
work.description: Communicate with the teaching team and students; Lead sections to review class materials and promote active learning; Design weekly quizzes and help to organize midterms and the final
